carbon_component: No direct equivalent; similar roles fulfilled by Grid, Tiles, Content Block
alignment_notes: Material UI Box is a generic, theme-aware container (like a styled <div>) with flexible styling via sx prop and component override. Carbon uses more specialized layout and container components instead of a generic box.
Both provide primary, secondary, and tertiary variants with hover/focus states.
FAB emphasizes primary action while Carbon uses icon buttons for similar purposes.
Both handle small interactive elements, though Carbon tags focus more on categorization.
Material's elevated cards vs Carbon's flat tiles for content grouping.
Similar modal dialog patterns with header/content/footer structure.
Transient messaging components with timeout controls.
Equivalent form inputs with validation states.
Identical selection controls with indeterminate states.
Single-select circular controls with similar grouping patterns.
Range selection components with discrete/continuous modes.
Both support horizontal navigation with indicator bars.
Material's bottom bar vs Carbon's header-focused UI Shell.
Linear/circular loading indicators with determinate states.
Single-select dropdowns with search/filter capabilities.
Material uses standalone dividers vs Carbon's list-integrated separators.
Similar calendar components with range selection.
Vertical item groupings with nested list support.
Carbon's enterprise-focused tables vs Material's simplified version.
Top navigation bars with search/action items.
Side navigation panels with collapsible sections.
Multi-select chips vs Carbon's categorization tags.
Sequential workflow visualization components.
Contextual hover information displays.
User/profile image containers with status indicators.
Notification counters and status indicators.
